channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @EladNehorai As long as they paid fealty to white patriarchal values, for sure.

@ManischewitzCo I saw! So sad that the rest of the world keeps going after we go to press.
@ManischewitzCo On the other hand, this may be new material for next week....

In which I bring the social media fun of @ManischewitzCo to the readers of print media. https://t.co/bvSvTbhhuo
https://t.co/0XNktWad8L

@trekonomics Well, there are worse ways for New Jersey and New York to resolve their current dispute over their joint Waterfront Commission. https://t.co/P4H91m8RaR
@trekonomics Though in some ways, those were more innocent times: “The last fight broke out in 1765, when the Jerseyans attempted to capture the leaders of the New York faction. Because the fight took place on the Sabbath, neither side used weapons.”
@segalmr @JanNWolfe Hoping Marc Elias will hold out for discovery.
@Historycourses Jefferson’s similar desire led to the Library of Congress.

Good thread. But worth adding that much conservative rhetoric is premised on erasing the multiplicity of minority communities. https://t.co/G78J6nwNJp
We see that very much when the topic of antisemitism comes up.

I think I already vaguetweeted an upcoming @BenYehudaPress project I'm very excited about but cannot yet announce, in part because the contract has not yet been signed. I just got off the phone with the author and am even more excited.
@BabblingBrookeA True of children, too, but that never stopped any parent.
@trekonomics Hard not to suspect that hanging around with Martin Peretz was not good for young Andrew’s soul. And I wonder about Leon’s influence.

Good piece, but it fails to directly address the fact that there are American Jewish forces who strongly prefer Israel and the United States to not be democratic. https://t.co/QUXWYQYsqQ
And if some left wing Jews get tossed from helicopters in the process, they won’t mind at all.

@prof_dainy Did you read Volume 1?
@prof_dainy I wonder how its historicity compares to Bob Dylan’s recent Titanic ballad. https://t.co/REZYmwcmzI
@typolad @ActuallyAviva Yes, we should.
@EladNehorai Oh, you wild-eyed optimist.
@EladNehorai But these people all have their nice Ben Shapiros and Dennis Prager to kasher them.
@kampeas But can Booker vouch for ability to give a spontaneous dvar Torah on the week’s parsha?
@owillis Never underestimate the importance of fluid mechanics.
@Daroff But what’s your suggestion to deal with the status quo absent an agreement?
@crispypadthai @AntifaVictim @steve_vladeck Also possible to thin it.
@reider @kampeas @972mag Looking forward to reading the results. But what does “social benefits” mean in an Israeli employment context?
@daroff, care to respond to these points? https://t.co/rBKrxpq6WL
@BenSorer @BenYehudaPress What I like about the translation is that the constraint means it can’t be direct peshat — and the little bit of drash makes the very familiar underlying text fresh again.
@Eric_Alterman Oy!

@BenSorer @BenYehudaPress God’s initial act in His constantly unfolding work of cosmogony was formation of our world and its sky. All was, at that point, without form, and chaotic. It was profoundly dark, with God’s Spirit floating in a cosmic limbo. God said: “Now for light!” And it was light!!
@BenSorer @BenYehudaPress God saw how good His light was, distinguishing light from dark. God’s light was known as “day.” Dark was known as “night.” Following nightfall was morning. A first day!!

@AvBronstein You say that like it’s a bad thing. You wouldn’t happen to be a rootless cosmopolitan, would you?
@AvBronstein Related: https://t.co/WmTgEW2yD9
